abstract: Google is working with Dow Jones, Condé Nast, Sony BMG Music and other large content companies to syndicate their video content on other Web sites.
snippet: Google is working with Dow Jones, Condé Nast, Sony BMG Music and other large content companies to syndicate their video content on other Web sites.
lead_paragraph: Google built an empire delivering advertisements across the Internet, and now it plans to distribute content from media companies just as aggressively.

headline.main: Google in Content Deal With Media Companies
headline.print_headline: Google in Content Deal With Media Companies

abstract: Yahoo and Google are facing a challenge from a tiny adversary named Quigo Technologies over contextual text ads online.
snippet: Yahoo and Google are facing a challenge from a tiny adversary named Quigo Technologies over contextual text ads online.
lead_paragraph: Google and Yahoo have been fighting it out over which company will dominate the online advertising business, with Google maintaining the upper hand so far.

headline.print_headline: An Ad Upstart Forces Google to Open Up a Little

abstract: Talk that Microsoft might (or at least, should) acquire Yahoo has been going on for months. On Monday, TheStreet.com’s Vishesh Kumar joined the chorus, writing that Google‘s continued encroachment on Microsoft’s territory might force the software giant’s hand. Last week, Google, already the leader of the online search business, introduced an upgraded version of its applications suite, which directly targets Microsoft’s venerable Office product.
lead_paragraph: Talk that Microsoft might (or at least, should) acquire Yahoo has been going on for months. On Monday, TheStreet.com’s Vishesh Kumar joined the chorus, writing that Google‘s continued encroachment on Microsoft’s territory might force the software giant’s hand. Last week, Google, already the leader of the online search business, introduced an upgraded version of its applications suite, which directly targets Microsoft’s venerable Office product.
